passage_text: 1 Sardines that are packed with extra ingredients such as mustard and olive oil are going to cost more than the standard sardine that is soaked in water. 2  Expect to pay an additional $2 to $3 more for a can of sardines with ingredients.
On average, sardines can cost anywhere from $1 to $4 per can.

1 Expect to pay an additional $2 to $3 more for a can of sardines with ingredients. 2  Sardines include the packaging as well as the liquid and ingredients that with which they are packed, which is usually tomato sauce or olive oil. 3  Some cans of sardines may include recipe ideas or tips for use.

1 They are usually are canned with olive oil or with a tomato sauce. 2  They are also sold in different quantities, which can also have an effect on the price. 3  On average, sardines can cost anywhere from $1 to $4 per can.

1 They are also sold in different quantities, which can also have an effect on the price. 2  On average, sardines can cost anywhere from $1 to $4 per can. 3  A higher quality sardine such as the Crown Prince Skinless and Boneless Sardines retail for $28 to $38 per 12 cans.

Sardine size varies from year to year depending on the current year class of sardine. Sardine caught in Washington's seine fishery ranges in size from 100 mm to 300 mm although the average length of sardine in Washington's fishery is typically 175-225 mm.

1 Sardines are usually sold in cans and they are widely available in grocery stores. 2  They are usually are canned with olive oil or with a tomato sauce. 3  They are also sold in different quantities, which can also have an effect on the price. 4  On average, sardines can cost anywhere from $1 to $4 per can.
